stories.title: Seasonal Fragrances and How They Shape Our Mood
stories.author: Emma Wilson
stories.content:
As the seasons change, so do our moods and the scents that resonate with us. Understanding how different fragrances align with seasonal shifts can help create a harmonious living space year-round.

Spring: Fresh and Floral

Spring calls for light, refreshing scents that mirror the blooming world outside. Citrus notes like lemon and bergamot bring energy, while floral scents such as jasmine and lavender create a sense of renewal.

Summer: Bright and Energizing

Summer fragrances should be vibrant and uplifting. Ocean-inspired scents, tropical fruits, and light florals help maintain a cool, refreshing atmosphere during warm months.

Autumn: Warm and Cozy

As temperatures drop, turn to warm, spicy scents. Cinnamon, vanilla, and amber create that perfect cozy feeling. Wood-based fragrances like sandalwood add depth and comfort.

Winter: Rich and Comforting

Winter is the time for deep, luxurious scents. Pine and fir bring the outdoors in, while spices like clove and nutmeg create a festive atmosphere. Don't forget the classics: vanilla and cocoa for ultimate comfort.

stories.title: Candle Care 101: Tips for Longer Burning
stories.author: Sarah Mitchell
stories.content:
Proper candle care not only extends the life of your candles but also ensures they burn safely and beautifully. Follow these expert tips to get the most out of your AURA candles.

The First Burn Matters

The first time you light your candle is crucial. Allow the wax to melt completely across the entire surface before extinguishing. This prevents tunneling and ensures even burning throughout the candle's life.

Trim the Wick

Before each use, trim the wick to 1/4 inch. This prevents excessive smoke, uneven burning, and maintains a steady flame. Use proper wick trimmers for best results.

Burn Time Guidelines

Never burn a candle for more than 4 hours at a time. This prevents the vessel from overheating and maintains the fragrance quality. Allow the candle to cool for at least 2 hours before relighting.

Keep It Clean

Remove any debris or wick trimmings from the wax pool. Keep the wax pool clear and clean for optimal burning and scent throw.

Safe Placement

Always place candles on a heat-resistant surface away from drafts, children, and pets. Never leave a burning candle unattended.

stories.title: How to Choose the Right Scent for Every Room
stories.author: Michael Chen
stories.content:
Each room in your home serves a different purpose, and the right fragrance can enhance its function while creating the perfect ambiance.

Living Room: Welcoming and Warm

Your living room is where you entertain and relax. Choose warm, inviting scents like vanilla, amber, or sandalwood. These create a cozy atmosphere that makes guests feel welcome.

Bedroom: Calming and Peaceful

For better sleep, opt for relaxing scents such as lavender, chamomile, or jasmine. These fragrances promote relaxation and help create a peaceful sleeping environment.

Kitchen: Fresh and Clean

Combat cooking odors with citrus-based scents like lemon, grapefruit, or mint. These fresh fragrances keep your kitchen smelling clean and inviting.

Bathroom: Spa-Like Serenity

Transform your bathroom into a spa with eucalyptus, sea salt, or fresh linen scents. These create a clean, refreshing atmosphere perfect for self-care routines.

Home Office: Focus and Energy

Boost productivity with invigorating scents like peppermint, rosemary, or citrus blends. These fragrances help maintain focus and mental clarity during work hours.
